title: Basildon Walks

images.title: Glyn Baker / Fishing lake in Gloucester Park
images.caption: Fishing lake in Gloucester Park

images.title: Andrew Pickess / Gloucester Park Basildon - A quiet corner
images.caption: Gloucester Park Basildon - A quiet corner. Within a few hundred yards of Basildon Town Centre lies the 250 acres of Gloucester Park. Numerous sports pitches, an athletics stadium and swimming pool. Just one of the many quiet areas in the park.

images.title: Abandoned Pavilion in Gloucester park by Glyn Baker, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Abandoned Pavilion in Gloucester park

images.title: Glyn Baker / Langdon Lake
images.caption: Langdon Lake. A relatively newly dug Lake in Langdon Nature Reserve. This is run by of Essex Wildlife Trust. The people were taking part in the 30th anniversary celebrations of the Trust taking on the reserve.

description: This major town in Essex has some fine local parks for walking and cycling. This walk in the town visits Gloucester Park where you will find some pleasant trails and a picturesque lake. Other local walking highlights include Langdon Hills Country Park and Wat Tyler Country Park where there are some well laid out footpaths to enjoy. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Basildon. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.
display_address: Clenshaw Path, Lee Chapel, Basildon, Essex, England, SS14 2FW, United Kingdom
